definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: So say ecologists in a commentary in the journalNature.
sentences.chinese: 生態學家在自然日誌的評論中這樣說道。

sentences.english: But the new guy has a different croak, which raised ecologists' suspicions.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個新傢伙叫聲很奇特，這令生態學家很疑惑。

sentences.english: The ecologists successfully lobbied the bill through.
sentences.chinese: 生態學家們進行遊說成功地使該法案得以通過。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact ethologists know this.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，生態學家知道這些。

sentences.english: Ecologist Sasha Kramer is helping to fight poverty in Haiti.
sentences.chinese: 生態學家薩沙克萊默幫助海地貧窮作鬥爭。

sentences.english: Liu Shurun is a grassland ecologist who lived in Inner Mongolia for many years.
sentences.chinese: 劉書潤，草原生態學家，曾在內蒙古生活多年。

sentences.english: Saturation of a biotope is of special interest to the ecologist.
sentences.chinese: 生境小區的飽和對生態學家是特別有意義的。
